pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:2.11: _Cīvara_ means both a finished robe and any cloth that can be used to make a robe. Thus I vary my translation depending on the context.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc25:3.1.10: The six are linen, cotton, silk, wool, sunn hemp, and hemp; see [](MS.3.1595). | According to [](MS.3.1680) this means not smaller than 8 by 4 _sugataṅgula_, or 40 by 20 cm based on my calculation of the _sugataṅgula_, “the standard fingerbreadth”, as 5 cm. For further explanation, see comment at _bhikkhu-saṅghādisesa_ 6.
